website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon AF-S DX 18-105mm f3.5-5.6G ED VR lens is a good choice for someone who wants more than the basic kit lens has to offer, while remaining compact and lightweight.
cons: All plastic construction, including lens mount

website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon AF-S DX Nikkor 18-105mm f/3.5-5.6G ED VR is a good alternative to an 18-55mm kit lens; it's sharp throughout its zoom range, and affordable.
cons: Softer edges at longer focal lengths

customer_reviews.title: Needs a metal mount
customer_reviews.text: Pros.....Very fast focusing and tack sharp. Delivers very acceptable images throughout the range and you can get very close to insects in manual mode. Cons....Comes in a plain white box which they don't bother to mention. Its a KIT lens which they fail to mention, and very expensive for such. A CON in every sense of the word. Cheap plastic mount so be careful you don't bump it into anything or it will snap off.
customer_reviews.author: Marella

customer_reviews.title: A great walk around lens
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens second hand, despite having reservations about doing so in the past. i had no need to worry, as the lens arrived, in my opinion, as good as new. The picture quality for a zoom lens is also very good. It will never compare with prime lenses, but then you only need one lens in your bag. A great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: B. V. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Great lens to travel with
customer_reviews.text: Great wide range lens, solid built. It's a perfect fit for my Nikon DX camera - D7000. The image quality is great. I bought this lens so I don't need to carry all my other heavy lenses with me when I go travelling, without missing the opportunity to cover wide range of distance. I took it out with me a few times when I was up on the mountain doing snowboarding so I can capture some nice pictures as well. Very handy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like having a new camera ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice lens. Bought it to go on my D300 (an old camera, now, but still, in my opinion, capable of good pics). Wanted something lighter than my 18-300 whopper kit lens that I bought when I got the D300 and which often caused me to leave my camera at home. D300 + this lens is a very nice combo, handles beautifully, it's like having a new camera.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality optics, robust and smooth zoom mechanism
customer_reviews.text: I am not an expert photographer and my mainly use this lens mounted to my Nikon DSLR is for astrophotography, usually when I am on holiday in placs where there is a dark sky. I have used in wide angle mode and at full zoom. At wide angle it is pretty accurate at shooting the night sky. However at high zoom I have been less impressed,. Having taken pictures of the moon and star constellations, teh results have been mixed. While the pictures of the moon were good, I wouldnt say the results were pin sharp, especially at ISO ratings of 800 and above.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great images and a very capable multi-function lens
customer_reviews.text: With the exception of my trusty 50mm Prime, this has now become my GO TO lens and is nearly always fitted on the camera. Great images and a very capable multi-function lens.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Turner

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best lens of my many for my Nikkon D7200
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best lens of my many for my Nikkon D7200. Very impressed. Really good width and depth. Highly recommended for the amateur photographer like me.
customer_reviews.author: Reidy RM

customer_reviews.title: Focus ring loose.
customer_reviews.text: Focus ring incredibly loose..Have to constantly refocus as the slightest touch on the ring takes view out of focus. Very disappointed, also plastic lens attacher suspect to damage .
customer_reviews.author: shaun coxall

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful lens particularly if you are into landscape photography. Those extra couple of mm's at the wide angle end do make a difference for what is essentially a standard zoom. Definition is excellent. The range is versatile enough to provide some telephoto capability and the VR means you can always crop without too much loss of clarity. Its a heavy lump though and whilst this provides a reassuring feeling of quality and substance, when added to a D7000 and a monopod, be prepared for a good workout when out in the field. Overall, love it.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great Walk About Lens for DSLR nikon Camera
customer_reviews.text: From experience when you buy Nikon DSLR camera it usually comes with the AF-S 18 to 105mm ED lens. If this is the case for you then as soon as you can afford it upgrade to this lens either for FX or DX Nikon camera. The difference in raw and jpg file quality, sharpness and overall performance is very dramatic. To realise the best from your camera ditch the AF-S 18-105 as soon as possible and buy this lens.
customer_reviews.author: MSR Hants

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Lens
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens, I am very much an amateur and this lens is hardly ever off my camera. Gives excellent results
customer_reviews.author: Ian C

customer_reviews.title: rather than buy another 16-85mm I bought this one due to cost and good reviews. I was not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this lens as my 16-85mm is faulty and needed a replacement while I decide what t do with the latter, rather than buy another 16-85mm I bought this one due to cost and good reviews. I was not disappointed, in fact this lens produces sharper and better colours way beyond the more expensive 16-85mm. Anyone wanting a an every day lens will not go wrong with this one. If I have a minor gripe, it does not come with a lens hood.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G

customer_reviews.title: My go to
customer_reviews.text: Been hiring this lense occasionally for acouple years and love it so much I finally decided to fork out the money for it. I don't own alot of lenses so I can't say it's better than this or that, but if your looking for an upgrade to your kit lense I'd say this is a good start.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: This has beocme the lens I leave on the camera most of the time, changing it for the 18-105mm when I am going sight seeing or a 35mm prime lens for portrait sessions. It is a good all rounder - light weight, short when collapsed, and a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: RD1234

customer_reviews.title: I've been using it on a D80 for a year and it is a good value general purpose lens
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for one which fell to the deck in a boating incident, jamming the barrel at a jaunty angle. I've been using it on a D80 for a year and it is a good value general purpose lens. Auto focus is quick and incredibly quiet compared to my older prime and telephoto lenses. The VR is impressive too, good for hip photography etc. I would think costs are kept low by using lightweight components so it is nice and lightweight but lacks robustness. However if you take care to avoid knocks it will serve you well.
customer_reviews.author: Woking Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: A good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have only briefly used this lens but it is clear that I won't be using my 55-300 Nikon lens any more. Whilst it is relatively heavy, the utility of having 18-300 on one lens is very useful and the build quality and photographs are also as good if not better. It also has two VR settings as well as ON and OFF; Normal and Active with active being used on moving objects. A lens lock is also a useful addition.
customer_reviews.author: York Terrier

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Nikkor lens from Korea
customer_reviews.text: The lens is new and good, but the lower price ones are imported from Korea.. In terms of warranty, there may be problems in UK, but then, again, for the price, if the lens fails, it's not worth repairing, in most cases repair quote will be higher than lens price.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Bania

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful lens, outstanding value.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a photographer in a number of technical disciplines for four plus decades, ultimately Nikon products were always my workhorse. This lens, as far as I am concerned represents outstanding value for money, both in terms of build quality and performance. If one wishes to commence on a hyper critical journey I feel quite sure from some, there will be criticism even nitpicking!!, however this lens, in my view, performs way beyond its price.
customer_reviews.author: kruger

customer_reviews.title: SUPER LENS
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this lens. In fact i use this lens most of the time and happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Sotesh Masson

customer_reviews.title: 16-85 DX Nikkor
customer_reviews.text: CRIKEY, I bought this lens to use at my sons wedding, I wanted a lens that would cover most situations on the day. So very pleased I bought this lens it fulfilled my every expectation, it is so sharp pin sharp I could hardly believe the results, but of course it is a Nikon lens. Most likely this lens will stay on my camera most of the time. Really happy and of course Amazon delivered very quickly indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Colindus

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!!
customer_reviews.text: I dont usually buy pre-owned but if they are all as good as this then I will buy more pre-owned more often. It looks brand new. The only ware is on the box corners but I dont care about that. The lens itself is outstanding!!
customer_reviews.author: Jethro225

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but not the latest model
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a direct replacement for a previous lens l'd had for five years. Although it was advertised as the latest model (VR2) the one I received was the old VR1 version, hence the three stars No real complaints tho' - it's a solid piece of kit, giving the results I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Biglad

customer_reviews.title: A fine "jobbing" lens for the enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that the lens came in a white box without any paperwork or registration papers but the lens works well. I own a better prime lens but I do think there is a great deal of posing about the superiority of primes over zooms. if you want a good image then look for good light rather than a faster lens is my motto.
customer_reviews.author: David A Gobey

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Super Lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens to me will be my 'stock' lens. Always found the smaller lens was just that and whilst I have 200 & 300 lenses they are more for long distance whereas as this will cover the very near and a fair distance as well. Our next holidag is weeks away and this will be used for 75% of the time. I could have bought a cheaper model but didnt want to reduce the pictures with an under performer. Best of all I cashed in the kids xmas vouchers with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: What a step up from the basic kit lens!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as I had damaged the supplied kit lens for my Nikon D5000. The images are clearer, the focus is accurate and the versatility is amazing. I previously had the 18-85mm set-up. I take a lot of portrait shots for my work as a dermatologist - basically, 'before and after' photos. I find that I am taking better quality photos. I have no regrets about upgrading. My brother-in-law likes to tell a story about how his old 3MP Canon took better photos than those with 10MP+ as he had invested heavily in top quality lenses. I get it now.
customer_reviews.author: Inspector Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Nikon AF-S DX Nikkor 18-55mm F3.3-5.6 G VR11 Lens
customer_reviews.text: The lens arrived very quickly in a plain white box, no instructions / guarantee, but well protected. The lens works a treat, it ideal for wide / medium views and is very light too which makes handling on the camera light. Am pleased with it. Registered it on the Nikon site. Good value for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: John Rushton

customer_reviews.title: The best photograph is taken when your lens is actually on your camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a one lens solution for most non-pro photographers. This lens is almost neve pr off my camera. Very well built, decent sharpness with some reduction in the corners while at its widest. The VR works brilliantly. The zoom lock I found almost no use for since even without it there is no noticeable zoom creep. I bought it at a super reduced price of £369 which makes it even more worth it.
customer_reviews.author: steventyp

customer_reviews.title: One lense for most photographic needs
customer_reviews.text: Rather than order a Nikon 3200 with the standard lens I ordered the body only then this 16-85mm lens and it is ace. Seeing the camera has 25 megapixels I can take distance shots and blow them up and indoors portraits or glamour have come out brilliant. Pictures are sharp and crisp and I cannot recommend this lens enough as it covers almost all but really long distance shots. Value for money and quality second to none.
customer_reviews.author: Moonshine

customer_reviews.title: I would reccomend this lense
customer_reviews.text: Bought this three years ago and still very happy with it. This lens has helped me take some incredible photos.
customer_reviews.author: graham

customer_reviews.title: Another excellent Nikon lens
customer_reviews.text: Am very pleased with the performance of this lens. Would buy it again. It complements my Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 35mm f/1.8G and is about the same size, so my D5300 with either lens fits neatly into the (minimalist) Lowepro Rezo TLZ 10 case. It was bought from Amazon and came with a European warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Pharos

customer_reviews.title: lovely lens
customer_reviews.text: lovely lens, lovely price. Excellent optics as you might expect, no distortions I have been able to identify. Relatively compact and not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Gentoo

customer_reviews.title: Good all rounder
customer_reviews.text: Having read many reviews on this lens and others similar, I decided to take the plunge as I really wanted a good walk about lens to save me having to swop lenses whilst out on walks, in all weathers. So glad I did, as I'm impressed with the images it produces when attached to a D7100, as well as the build quality, size and weight. When I have more time and want to get creative I stick a prime on. Best of both worlds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nikon zoom
customer_reviews.text: this lens has a slightly longer zooming range than the 18-55 mm zoom lens which is often supplied as standard with a Nikon body. As such the bigger zoom range means that you will not be changing lenses so often. It is certainly a very sharp and well made lens as one would expect from such a major camera manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: The South Lincs Geoff Brown

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to expectations.!
customer_reviews.text: Crisp and sharp at all distances. Compact when not in use. Well built yet light. Can't fault it. Recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: geodenland

customer_reviews.title: BRILLIANT LENS
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, the results are amazing and oin sharp every time
customer_reviews.author: Terence Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: If I could only have one lens this would be it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this lens for 18 months now and use it on a D80. It's a brilliant all round lens that produces sharp images. The focusing is fast and accurate and the vibration reduction works well letting you take hand held shots in fairly low light conditions. I've got two D80s and leave this lens permanently on one of the bodies which I use as my go everywhere camera. If I could only have one lens this would be the one I would choose.
customer_reviews.author: Nat L

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: If you want a lens that covers almost all your wishes and not over powering when on the camera this is ideal. It covers most of the range that you would normally use as an amateur photographer. No messing around switching lenses. Once it is installed it fulfills most of your needs.I purchased the Nikon 5100 with the two lenses which I was very satisfied with but would I have done that if I had bought the camera with this lense is another matter. Impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Draw

customer_reviews.title: Great lens - exactly what you'd expect from Nikon
customer_reviews.text: Having recently bought Nikon 7000d and 300mm lens I wanted something for more everyday use and settled on this having read a number of reviews on this and other Nikon lenses. The action in smooth and focus is quick and crisp and the quality as you'd expect from Nikon. Overall a great lens that will stay on the camera for all circumstances except the long range wildlife stuff when I go to the mountains of Southern Spain in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing lens at an affordable price. First, the look and feel are very sturdy - unlike it's predecessors - and the handling is smooth. Second, the picture quality is amazing. I have not tested it fully for falloff etc, but shot some landscape and portraits which all turned out great. It can handle low light as well. Great all-round lens for the price.
customer_reviews.author: wolfman07

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens
customer_reviews.text: I have just received the Nikon 18-200mm lens, which is for use with a Nikon D60. I originally purchased a tamron 18- 200 mm lens which I was not happy with when using it at full zoom. The Nikon absolutely surpasses the Tamron . This will be the main lens I will use now and it is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. L. S. Winter

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Misses focus "a lot" and has trouble with contest. Over compensates in low light. Would steers clear if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good multi-purpose Nikon lens.
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today and I am pretty pleased. It is heavy - considerably heavier than the Sigma 18-250 mm which my wife uses, so it may not suit everyone to carry this around all day. My initial photos look fine with good image sharpness and contrast. I want to use it as a travel lens to save me carrying and constantly changing 2 lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Razor sharp lens !!!
customer_reviews.text: Received the lens today, and on first shots it is excellent producing very sharp clear photos. Colour rendition is also excellent. This is one of the sharpest Nikon lenses I have used. Would highly recommend this lens.
customer_reviews.author: StevenB

customer_reviews.title: Great photographic quality
customer_reviews.text: Yet another stunning lens from Nikon. Unless you're a camera geek or you need to use prime lenses for your livelihood, this will do what 99% of people, will think is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Graeme H.

customer_reviews.title: Supply of Nikon Lens
customer_reviews.text: Ordering the item was simple, straight forward and fast. Great comparisons on the web site. In fact I have ended up with a much more expensive product than originally intended. Have just started using the lens and delighted with the end results so far. Looking forward excitedly to many great photographs in the future! The response and delivery went exactly as requested and I am delighted with the product. I can certainly recommend this product and supplier to anyone who needs accessories for their cameras. Many thanks. Much appreciated Ted
customer_reviews.author: Ted Fowles

customer_reviews.title: Excellent versatility.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens and so versatile. I use it as my general lens with a 35 mm prime for dark interiors or evening shots when I don't want to use a tripod, and the 70 -300mm Nikkor for those close ups...!
customer_reviews.author: Mizzen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to uderstand and gives an image with which I ...
customer_reviews.text: As a complete beginner to DSLR I can only say that it does exactly what I wanted and expected it to do. Easy to uderstand and gives an image with which I am very happy most of the time and the exceptions I know are my fault.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. G. Bird

customer_reviews.title: Great lens ¬
customer_reviews.text: It is a great lens and feel great. Fast and silent movement as described. The pictures are sharp and colourful. Nothing really to say as you are buying a Nikkor lens. I definitely recommend this lens. Cheers, Mike
customer_reviews.author: M. Levasseur

customer_reviews.title: ... put off by the low price this is very good kit lens only had it for a day and ...
customer_reviews.text: do not be put off by the low price this is very good kit lens only had it for a day and very happy to use it. No guarantee but at this price not a problem! defiantly a genuine Nikkor (Nikon) lens. crystal clear photos very little if any CA. would but again.
customer_reviews.author: merlin

customer_reviews.title: quick delivery and good price
customer_reviews.text: quick delivery and good price - nice lens which has produced excellent results - I am not a professional so if you need better reviews please check others but I am perfectly happy with it - I am using it on a Nikon D200
customer_reviews.author: Richard Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Great general lens
customer_reviews.text: Superb lens that compliments the camera well get some good close up pictures and long range not bad quality. Have taken some nice portraits and misty water shots.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nikon VR 18-200 lens
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for an older model so I knew what I was getting. An ideal go anywhere versatile lens although a bit heavy to cart around all day on a D90 - but worth the effort. I have no complaints - a super lens for the money. The results have won me competitions at my camera club so can't be bad!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. M. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile lens and a great company to deal with
customer_reviews.text: Lens works great, boxed with all internal packaging and paperwork, it even had the lens hood included which I wasn't expecting. The silver Nikon logo on the lens cap is worn but for the great price I'm not even going to mention that
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Zoom
customer_reviews.text: Great walkabout lens, saves the need to carry lots of separate lenses
customer_reviews.author: elm

customer_reviews.title: Yes its a budget lens but it feel good quality *Note* that a HB-32 lens hood comes with ...
customer_reviews.text: Go along with what most of the other reviews have said, Yes its a budget lens but it feel good quality *Note* that a HB-32 lens hood comes with the lens, I ordered one separately because I the lens info never mentioned it, will lose £3.99 p&p on the returned hood, otherwise happy.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Great little lens.
customer_reviews.text: Great little lens, with the #ll lens you can get in a lot closer to your subject than with the previous model. A lovely light lens for good sharp photos. Fast deliverary, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: JollyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality is great.
customer_reviews.text: A very good lens that makes the quality of my pictures better. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Evona

customer_reviews.title: Good quality lens with a good zoom range
customer_reviews.text: Good quality lens with a good zoom range, good for portraiture and landscapes. Good clarity of image with, very little image edge distortion what there is is more apparent at the 16mm end of the lens range.
customer_reviews.author: Eng

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Nikon lens.
customer_reviews.text: This lens performs brilliantly and is very light leaving the Nikon D7000 well balanced. The two work very well together and is currently my standard lens kept on the camera providing excellent results with the full range of shots from wide angle to moderate telephoto and also excellent macro.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. I Cul

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. Was previously working with the 18-55 kit lens and a 55-200 f4-5.6 but that meant swapping lenses. As I don't need a 200mm lens this works great for my own needs and no more changing lenses over K
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: 18-105 lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens and genuine article. Gives me more flexibility than the standard lens. Camera is well balanced with this lens attached. Due to bigger diameter than standard lens I gain nearly one stop in exposure values.
customer_reviews.author: AlanB

customer_reviews.title: Better than the original kit lens I got with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Better than the original kit lens I got with my D40 due to VR. Am almost pleased I had to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Briggle

customer_reviews.title: Let there be light
customer_reviews.text: Superb and versatile lens. For landscapes, skyscrapers, close ups and nature shots, this is my absolute favourite (I accidentally broke the original)
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Plain box ?
customer_reviews.text: Seems OK, but I am puzzled as to why it arrived in a plain white box rather than in a Nikon box. Could it be counterfeit?
customer_reviews.author: Georgie Porgie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic kit lens
customer_reviews.text: Replaces my last Nikkor 18-105mm. Fantastic kit lens, only wish Nikon would fit them with a metal bayonet which does't crumble like my last one did. Might have to buy another in a couple of years. Never the less, very happy. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: John Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Replaces the standard 18-55 zoom
customer_reviews.text: Paired this lens with a NIKON D3200, which with it's 24 Mpel sensor can with picture cropping deliver the equivalent of a longer zoom with minimal loss of image quality.
customer_reviews.author: T. JONES

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is now my standard lens, delighted with photographic results, but a little disappointed with the plastic mount. For a pittance more, Nikon could have made this metal. Five stars for picture quality, four for plastic mount.
customer_reviews.author: Riffraff

customer_reviews.title: Good value all rounder lens
customer_reviews.text: Good value all rounder lens. Seems to meet a wide range of needs, bought to go with a D7500, review elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Delboy Rud

customer_reviews.title: Excellent travel lens!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent travel lens!! Can\t say I am sorry to purchase this lens. Exceeds my expectations after reading a lot of reviews that were not in flavor of this lens. You'd get used to the bulk and a bit on the heavy side.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Rosenstroem

customer_reviews.title: Nice Nikon.
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery, the lens is fantastic, a must for all nikon DSLR cameras, I'm very pleased with the service and my purchase, recommended trader..
customer_reviews.author: John Hart

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mark2 lens to replace my original mark1 which was damaged. I like the smaller size when locked which packs more easily and is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Brearley

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly with D5200
customer_reviews.text: I got this lens as the only lens with a body only D5200 purchase from Jessops. The price was slightly higher than buying the camera with a kit lens. This is my first DSLR purchase. This combination works very well and has given some of the best pictures i have ever seen. The purpose of the camera is to click pictures of our two very fast moving kids, I must say I am not disappointed with the result.
customer_reviews.author: UK Pabby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens for its money. I bought it around £200 used.
customer_reviews.author: Stelios

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my Nikon D300s.
customer_reviews.text: This lens if wonderful, it feels so nicely balanced and although not light is perfect when fitted to the camera. Build quality is as you would expect from Nikon. I can`t fault this lens for my type of photography, which mainly landscape.
customer_reviews.author: NIKOND300S

customer_reviews.title: Great all purpose lens
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. now I can go out and take landscapes with just this lens. impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Redcurtain

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Lens
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lens to replace a similar model that was broken. Great Quality Lens, very light, very small, useful range, and the added benefit of Vibration Reduction. All you could need in a general zoom lens.
customer_reviews.author: DxDuff

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Tamron imitation that I just gave up
customer_reviews.text: I've not ahd much chance to play with this, but it seems sturdy and sharp. Easy to use and I love the different focussing options. Can really play around with depth of field. When I bought my camera I saved and bought a Tamron lens -which died after about two years - this is a real step up.
customer_reviews.author: GLK

customer_reviews.title: Cracking lens
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the holiday of a lifetime and it didn't disappoint. Sharp, contrasty and quick to focus. Lovely general purpose lens and a great successor to the 18 - 70. I can't praise it enough. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. G. A. Trimble

customer_reviews.title: Good all round tool
customer_reviews.text: I use a 16mm - 85mm and a 70mm - 300mm normally, but when it comes to a day out in London, or Goodwood for the festival of speed, you can't beat an all round lens, this is one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John M. Desborough

customer_reviews.title: Good walkabout lens
customer_reviews.text: I currently have the 18-200 lens and although it has given me thousands of excellent photos, the quality at the longer focal lengths was not ideal with noticeable softness on one side of the image. My kit now includes the 16-85 lens which will stay on my camera for probably 90% of the time and when I need a bit extra reach will also take the 70-300 lens. Optical quality of the 16-85 seems good across all of the focal lengths so I am looking forward to some further testing soon.
customer_reviews.author: derekg57

customer_reviews.title: Covers most everyday requirements
customer_reviews.text: Excellent results so far but it is early days yet. The zoom range is perfect for most situations and, whilst it's not quite so well balanced on my D3200 as the 18 - 55 kit lens, that seems a small price to pay for versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Lens
customer_reviews.text: Took this lens on holiday with my d5100 and a 50mm for indoor shots. Have to say having processed holiday pic which covered everything this has proved to be superb. Very happy I decided to buy as it is the perfect travel lens replacing my 55-200 and 18-55.
customer_reviews.author: MR G ARBUCKLE

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant lens for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have recently bought this lens for my Nikon D90. Very pleased with the results. Lightweight lens with a very good focal range. A good lens to leave on camera for everyday use without the need for changing lenses too often.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Speller

customer_reviews.title: was very satisfied with the purchase and the delivery time
customer_reviews.text: ! was very satisfied with the purchase and the delivery time, but there was no sales/product receipt in the box in case I need to return it.
customer_reviews.author: cate.1

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous and excellent... 200%.....
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fabulous, was delivered very quickly.. Item bought second hand was in perfect condition and, would recommend 150% while certainly my first 'go see' from now on for my purchases. Thank you, Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I now never take this lens off my Nikon - ...
customer_reviews.text: I now never take this lens off my Nikon - it has so far covered all of my lens needs. It feels well built and of solid construction. I was not able to take advantage of the Nikon cash-back scheme as it transpires that the lens I received is a "grey market" one.
customer_reviews.author: Phil P

customer_reviews.title: Quick, great price, best 'all round' lense
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery- amazing price (got it in the '39% off' offer. This is my favourite Nikon lense by far as it allows you to quickly change from close ups to far away frames and generally is useful in All situations. I am very excited about having this once more (I dropped and broke my previous one)..
customer_reviews.author: Susieqbaer

customer_reviews.title: Lovely
customer_reviews.text: There is always a place for one of those lenses that nearly does it all and this nearly does. There is always compromise and yes it is a slow lens in terms of if's f stop fully open, and in how quickly or not it focuses on auto. I still love it
customer_reviews.author: David King

customer_reviews.title: This lens is now almost a permanent fixture on my ...
customer_reviews.text: This lens is now almost a permanent fixture on my Nikon D5100 DSLR. It is a superb piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C Bovill

customer_reviews.title: Allrounder
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens about a month ago. I can comfortably say, its one of the better investments I've made. The extra 2mm is all what I was looking for. I basically needed a lens between a wide angle lens and a teleport and the 16 to 85 fit the bill. The one less star is only for the price which I reckon is slightly over.
customer_reviews.author: Anderson Oliveira

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp images
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp images from this lenses, as good as the Nikkor 18-55mm standard type zoom lens normally bundled with a camera. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Steveosnapper

customer_reviews.title: Best buy this year
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of kit, and priced really competitively. Would 100% recommend this seller
customer_reviews.author: Ravenhunter

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value ... As advertised ... Fast Delivery ... A+
customer_reviews.author: prenticemarie

customer_reviews.title: Good versatile lens.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens to replace the basic 18-55 mm kit lens . It allows me to have a bit more reach without the FFA of swapping to my 55-200 telephoto. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 18-105 great lens
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for my new Nikon AF-S DX 18-105 and you know the rest its great I'm going out later to try my new lens out on the Humber bridge But looks a great lens .. thanks for all your help I'm very pleased . Take your stranded 50mm lens off and replace it with the 18-105 as an every-day lens as you can do a lot more with only one lens . Thanks Steve
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job. Worth every penny. Make sure you buy a uv filter though
customer_reviews.author: eric_the_b

customer_reviews.title: Nikon AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G VR II lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens. Much better than the standard 18 - 55 that came with my Nikon 5200 camera. That one broke within 3 months as the autofocus stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with this lens and would recommend it, good sharp pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Noonerz

customer_reviews.title: Nikon AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-200mm f/3.5-5.6G ED VR II Lens
customer_reviews.text: This is a superlative product. Love it. It's the best walk-about lens for a Nikon DX camera. I have found the 18 - 200 mm range really useful for scenery, flowers and birds. It's fast enough for bird-in-flight, steady enough hand-held for slow shots with great depth of focus and wide enough for most architectural (street-scape and inside buildings) photos I've wanted to do. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with product performance and certainly versatile all round lense
customer_reviews.author: Discerning shopper

product_meta.title: Nikon AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-105 mm f/3.5-5.6G ED VR Lens
product_meta.description:
Size Name:18-105 mmThe AF-S DX NIKKOR f/3.5–5.6G VR from Nikon has just become even more attractive to D-SLR enthusiasts. More compact and portable than its predecessor, this multi-purpose retractable lens is the easy way to capture the moment. The 3x zoom combined with advanced Nikon technology offers optical quality and versatility, delivering high-contrast photos and movies. Suited to everything from flattering portraits to action-packed events, this is the ideal lens to accompany you on your travels. Featuring Nikon’s second-generation Vibration Reduction system (VR), this lightweight lens can provide images free of blur due to camera shake at all focal lengths. Designed to enable stable hand-held shooting, Nikon’s VR technology allows you to use shutter speeds up to 4 stops slower than would otherwise be possible, resulting in sharp images, even in low light. Being an optical system, the viewfinder image is also stabilised, enabling more accurate autofocus acquisition and framing. So whether you are zooming in to capture faraway subjects or shooting wide-angle group portraits in low light, the AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G VR will deliver crisp, clear shots. The lens comprises eleven elements in eight groups, in a design including one aspherical lens element. For a soft rendering effect, the iris diaphragm has seven rounded blades, producing high-quality natural backgrounds. The aspherical lens element helps eliminate problems of distortion and other types of lens aberrations to ensure high-resolution, contrast and deliver required image quality.

LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Must be at least 18 & over to purchase

MANUFACTURER'S DESCRIPTION
DX-format, high-power 5.8x zoom lens with focal length ranging from 18 to 105mm.

Broad picture angle range approximates the perspective of a 27-157.5mm lens on a 35mm-format film camera or Nikon FX-format digital SLR.

 Covers diverse shooting situations from wide-angle landscapes and interiors to portraiture and medium-range sports.

 Vibration Reduction assures sharper handheld pictures while shooting at shutter speeds up to three stops slower than would otherwise be possible.

Built-in Silent Wave Motor delivers quiet, swift autofocus with superior accuracy. 

High-performance optical system featuring an ED glass element and an aspherical lens element realizes superior image reproduction capability.

 The rounded 7-blade diaphragm opening renders out-of-focus elements more naturally.

 Leather texture matches Nikon digital SLR’s body high-quality exterior design.

BOX CONTAINS


AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-105mm f/3.5-5.6G ED VR lens 2x lens covers One year's manufacturer guarantee

See more
feature_bullets: Highly compact and lightweight body - achieved by incorporating a retractable lens mechanism
5.8x zoom lens offers a versatile wide-angle to moderate telephoto perspective that's suited to everything from landscapes and interiors to portraits and action
Vibration Reduction (VR) function provides an effect equivalent to a shutter speed 4.0 stops faster
With the minimum focus distance of 0.25 m/0.8 ft (in MF), you can get much closer to the subject
High optical 11 elements in eight groups and an aspherical lens element minimises spherical aberration and other forms of distortion while ensuring high resolution and contrast

specifications.Included Components: CL-1018 Soft Case, HB-32 Bayonet Lens Hood, AF-S DX NIKKOR 18-105mm f/3.5-5.6G ED Vibration Reduction Zoom Lens for Nikon DSLR Cameras, LF-4 Rear Lens Cap, LC-67 Snap-on Front Lens Cap
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,883 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
